items.author: Brian Truitt
items.content: Just like the first one, Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2 is a winning and wonderfully relatable gem of crazy.

items.author: Chris Hewitt (1)
items.content: Even when the pixels threaten to overwhelm, Gunn finds refuge in his main characters. There’s plenty to enjoy here.

items.author: Robbie Collin
items.content: That sense of gooey euphoria runs through everything that’s good in Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 2.
The Guardians get a welcome return to the big screen, which despite many positives, fails to match the dizzying heights of the original.

items.author: Alonso Duralde
items.content: There is wit and there are explosions, and while none of them represent a step above “Guardians of the Galaxy,” neither do they impugn the memory of one of the freshest and most fun of the Marvel movies.

items.author: Owen Gleiberman
items.content: Shot for shot, line and line, it’s an extravagant and witty follow-up, made with the same friendly virtuosic dazzle. Yet this time you can sense just how hard the series’ wizard of a director, James Gunn (now taking off from a script he wrote solo), is working to entertain you. Maybe a little too hard.

items.author: Eric Kohn
items.content: Much of the material gets rehashed with slight variations...and many of the space battles have a redundant quality.

items.author: Chris Nashawaty
items.content: It’s smarter than most films, but not as smart as the first one. It’s funnier than most films, but not as funny as the first one. And it still probably belongs in the upper tier of Marvel movies but nowhere near as high up as the first one.

items.author: Peter Bradshaw
items.content: It’s fun, though GOTG2 doesn’t have the same sense of weird urgency and point that the first film had. They’re still guarding, although the galaxy never seems in much danger.

items.author: Todd McCarthy
items.content: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2 plays like a second ride on a roller-coaster that was a real kick the first time around but feels very been-there/done-that now.
